data.description: Have you ever stepped off a train and realized you weren't in your world anymore? Kisaragi Station is Japan's most terrifying urban legend about a place that doesn't exist on any map. In this video, we explore the chilling account of a passenger who vanished into a liminal space where the laws of physics break down. Is it a portal to another dimension or a glitch in reality? Watch until the end to see the one-legged man who haunts the tracks. Tell us in the comments: if the doors opened to an empty, nameless station, would you get off? Experience the eerie silence of Japanese Horror and explore the deep lore of Urban Legends that inspired the Backrooms movement. Don't forget to subscribe for more Creepy Supernatural stories from the shadows.
data.editorial_notes:
【プロフェッショナル協議記録】
1. Viral Architect: タイトル案として「I'm trapped at Kisaragi Station」「The Forbidden Station」「NEVER Exit the Train at This Station」を提案。最も強い警告を含み、視聴者の生存本能に訴えかける『NEVER Exit the Train at This Station』を採択。冒頭1秒で『降りてはいけない』というルールを提示し、視聴維持率を最大化します。
2. The Whisperer: 『リミナルスペース』特有の、静寂が物理的な重圧を持つ感覚を重視。日本的な湿り気を『breathes』『ancient rot』といった表現で英語台本に落とし込みました。
3. The Visionary: Midjourneyのプロンプトには、日本の古い駅特有の『緑がかった蛍光灯』や『湿ったコンクリート』の質感を指定。アナログホラー（VHS風）の粒子感を加えることで、現実味のある恐怖を演出します。
data.vrew_script:
Midnight train stops at a station with no name
The doors open to a silence that breathes
My phone says there is no track here
A single platform illuminated by flickering cold lights
The signs are written in a script I cannot read
Distant bells ring from the dark forest edge
An old man limps closer with only one leg
His eyes reflect a sky that should not exist
The air smells of ozone and ancient rot
If you see Kisaragi Station do not step out
Because once you arrive you can never go back
